title: How to Make Mexican Stuffed Shells

steps.headline: Boil the jumbo shells in a large pot of water, until tender and al dente.
Drain the pasta shells in a colander and shake gently to dry.
Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook the ground beef and onion in a saucepan until fully cooked.
steps.description: Stir around with a wooden spoon on medium high heat.

steps.headline: Remove the excess grease from the saucepan.
Stir in the taco seasoning and mix with the wooden spoon.
Add the cream cheese and stir until the cheese melts.
steps.description: Shut off the stove and set aside.

steps.headline: In a small bowl, combine the enchilada sauce and salsa.
Pour half of the salsa mixture on a 9 x 13 baking pan and spread it around.
Stuff and fill each pasta shell with a tablespoon of the ground beef mixture.
steps.description: Repeat until there are no more shells.

steps.headline: Place all the shells on the baking pan and pour the rest of the salsa mixture over the shells.
Cover the pan with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil off the pan and sprinkle on the cheese.
Bake for an additional 15 minutes, until the cheese melts and bubbles.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice and serve the Mexican stuffed shells on a serving plate. Garnish with parmesan cheese if desired. Enjoy!

text: Boil the jumbo shells in a large pot of water, until tender and al dente.  Drain the pasta shells in a colander and shake gently to dry.  Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.  Cook the ground beef and onion in a saucepan until fully cooked. Stir around with a wooden spoon on medium high heat. Remove the excess grease from the saucepan.  Stir in the taco seasoning and mix with the wooden spoon.  Add the cream cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Shut off the stove and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the enchilada sauce and salsa.  Pour half of the salsa mixture on a 9 x 13 baking pan and spread it around.  Stuff and fill each pasta shell with a tablespoon of the ground beef mixture. Repeat until there are no more shells. Place all the shells on the baking pan and pour the rest of the salsa mixture over the shells.  Cover the pan with foil and bake for 30 minutes.  Remove the foil off the pan and sprinkle on the cheese.  Bake for an additional 15 minutes, until the cheese melts and bubbles.  Serve. Slice and serve the Mexican stuffed shells on a serving plate. Garnish with parmesan cheese if desired. Enjoy!
